court: IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
judgment_text:
:1:

IN IN IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY

IN IN IN ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION ITS INSOLVENCY JURISDICTION

OFFICIAL OFFICIAL OFFICIAL ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006 ASSIGNEE S REPORT DATED 1ST DECEMBER, 2006

IN IN IN

INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY INSOLVENCY NO. 100 OF 1956 NO. 100 OF 1956 NO. 100 OF 1956

Re: Noshir Nawroji Katrak.

... Insolvent.

Ex-parte :

Homi P. Signapeira

... Petitioning Creditors.

....

Mr. Y.C. Parikh, Official Assignee present.

.....

CORAL CORAL CORAL : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J. : DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD,J.

th th th DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006. DECEMBER 2006.

P.C. P.C. P.C. : : :

.

An order of adjudication was passed on 3rd October

.

The Official Assignee had declared three dividends;

first

of

Rs.0.100

ps.

in a rupee to

the

preferential

creditors

and Rs.0.2 /2 ps.

to the unsecured

creditors

on

st May , second of Rs.0.02 ps.

in a rupee to the

unsecured

creditors

on st November and

third

of

Rs.0.03

ps.

in a rupee on st November .

In

the

present

case, no further recoveries are possible.

There

is a cash balance of Rs.4390/- lying in the estate as

against the proved unsecured liability of Rs.4,68,711/-.

.

The Official Assignee has prayed that cash balance

of

Rs.4390/- may be transferred to the unclaimed dividend

capital

account

under Rule of the Bombay

Insolvency

Rules, and

thereafter to

the

unclaimed

dividend

:2:

capital revenue account and the account may be closed for

administrative purposes.

.

Having regard to the circumstances set out in the

report

of

the Official Assignee, there is no reason

why

the

prayer

should not be granted.

Prayer clause (a)

of

the report of the Official Assignee is accordingly

granted.

-----
